definition: lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
as/as if/such as
Tu (ethnic group)/surname Tu
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Living in luxurious surroundings, he spends money like water.
sentences.chinese: 他生活在奢侈的環境中，揮金如土。

sentences.english: What money he could lay his hands on, he spent like an Indian rajah.
sentences.chinese: 只要他能夠搞到錢，他揮金如土就像印度君主那樣。

sentences.english: Some love minimalist design, and would splash out on modern minimalist furniture.
sentences.chinese: 有些愛極簡設計，願意在現代派極簡傢俱上揮金如土。

sentences.english: The spender will say, 'I'll cut back.'
sentences.chinese: 揮金如土的人會說，‘我要削減開支。’

sentences.english: In the restaurant business now it's the Chinese who are the big spenders. The tables have been completely turned at the high-end places.
sentences.chinese: 而現在在餐廳裏揮金如土的是中國人。

sentences.english: If you spend money like water, you'll go bankrupt sonner or later.
sentences.chinese: 如果你揮金如土的話，早晚會破產的。

sentences.english: Many American big spenders are on the edge of bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 許多美國揮金如土的人，面臨破產。

sentences.english: However, flames of Ceiba flowers have burnt away all dullness in the fever, squanderingly.
sentences.chinese: 一朵一朵木棉花揮金如土般燃燒掉了高溫裏的呆滯。

sentences.english: Stop spending so fst , or you'll end up as a beggar.
sentences.chinese: 不要揮金如土，否則你最終會成爲乞丐的。

sentences.english: She drives away those who have squandered their wealth and want her to bail them out.
sentences.chinese: 而她會趕走那些揮金如土，希望她救助的人。

sentences.english: Despite a large income, the actor had saved very little because he is profuse spender.
sentences.chinese: 這個演員雖然收入不菲，但是揮金如土，積蓄甚少。

sentences.english: He attempts to woo her in a characteristically extravagant manner.
sentences.chinese: 他嘗試過用揮金如土的闊綽方式去取悅於她。

sentences.english: Is it true that Americans are prodigal ?
sentences.chinese: 美國人真的是揮金如土嗎？

sentences.english: The hustlers and high rollers at Wall Street’s gaming tables are starting to feel lucky again.
sentences.chinese: 華爾街賭桌上的揮金如土的賭客們再次感到好運光臨。

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
Vanity Fair (novel and magazine title)
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
manner/style/panache
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
talented field commander (military)
power struggle
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
exclusive property/forbidden domain
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
old school/conservative faction
